intro: Micranthes redofskyi, commonly known as the Redofsky's mouse-ear, is a small herbaceous plant native to the rocky habitats of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant features dense, hairy foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, and they bloom in early spring. Micranthes redofskyi is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a resilient species in its native range.
